isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - ROCKWELL 9, 10, AND 13 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS - GEAR TIMING - TIMING MARKS IN TRANSMISSION CASE

note.para: To make sure timing marks are in the correct locations, count the number of gear teeth, divide the total teeth number by "2" and put the mark in the correct location.

step1.para: Put timing marks on the main drive gear on the input shaft. Mark one tooth with paint. Mark a second tooth opposite (180°) the first timing mark ( Figure 5).

Use paint to put timing marks on two teeth next to each other on each driven gear of the main countershafts. Make sure the marks are aligned with the slot for the key or the "O" stamping on the countershaft ( Figure 5).
During assembly, each of the two timing marks on the main drive gear must be between the two marked teeth on each countershaft drive gear ( Figure 6).
All the timing marks must be aligned if the transmission is to operate correctly.
If the timing marks are not painted in the correct position on the gears, only one set of marks will be aligned.

note.para: The main shaft and the auxiliary drive gear must be installed when the alignment marks in the transmission case are checked.

step1.para: To check the alignment of the timing marks, rotate the input shaft. All the gears must rotate.
